data.title: How should I travel to the ground?
data.meta_description: In line with guidance for all major stadiums and venues, supporters are encouraged to arrive at London Stadium as early as possible. Supporters are advised to use all available routes to London Stadium in order to assist with keeping your distanc...
data.text:
In line with guidance for all major stadiums and venues, supporters are encouraged to arrive at London Stadium as early as possible. Supporters are advised to use all available routes to London Stadium in order to assist with keeping your distance on public transport and when arriving to and leaving the stadium, wherever possible.

If using public transport, please ensure you follow all the guidelines for your chosen transport provider. For the latest travel advice visit www.nationalrail.co.uk or www.tfl.gov.uk. Alternatively, you may wish to visit the transport operatorsâ€™ website directly.

Please plan your journey in advance and check timetables to ensure you arrive at the ground at least 60 minutes before kick-off.

To assist with queueing times we recommend that supporters arrive via the bridge closest to your turnstile.

Please see the map below:

There are five train and tube destinations in close proximity to London Stadium, served by a number of train lines.

Select your route below:

Stratford station

Stratford International station

Stratford High Street station

Pudding Mill Lane station

Hackney Wick station

Stratford station

Stratford station is approximately 20 minutes-walk from London Stadium.

Stratford station is served by:

Docklands Light Railway (DLR)

London Underground Jubilee and Central Line services

National Rail operated by C2C and Greater Anglia

TfL Rail

Elizabeth Line

London Overground

If travelling through Stratford Station, please note supporters will be using the Northern Ticket Hall entrance before and after the game, located opposite the entrance to Westfield, this is to assist with social distancing in the station. Access will not be available through the outside area of Westfield Shopping Centre by the Cow pub (Westfield Avenue/Chestnut Plaza) due to the one-way system in place at Westfield Avenue.

Stratford International station

Stratford International station is approximately 20 minutes-walk from London Stadium.

Stratford International station is served by:

Docklands Light Railway (DLR)

National Rail operated by Southeastern

Stratford High Street station

Stratford High Street station is served by:

Docklands Light Railway (DLR)

Pudding Mill Lane station

Pudding Mill Lane Station is located to the south of London Stadium and is approximately ten minutes-walk away.

Pudding Mill Lane Station is served by:

Docklands Light Railway (DLR)

Hackney Wick station

Hackney Wick Station is located to the north west of London Stadium and is approximately ten minutes-walk away.

Hackney Wick Station is served by:

London Overground

For more information, to plan your journey, or check any travel disruptions please visit tfl.gov.uk or nationalrail.co.uk

Was this article helpful?

Our Supporter Services team are available from Monday to Friday, 09:00 - 17:00 and on home matchdays from two hours before kick-off.

You can get in touch with us by:

West Ham Help Centre: Submitting an enquiry

Email: supporterservices@westhamunited.co.uk
